text:
Hello,
Is it possible to hide information from contact main page in case if property has certain value?
For example in this case I would like to hide lead status in case if value is New
Well, you could create a conditional section that will only show if it meets the criteria you set and add the properties you want to hide in that section.

Thank you very much <@U01GW2U4WMA>
Can you also help me to hide on option from this list?
For example in your case I would like to hide `Platinum`  for example
I need to make it possible to select gold only from api, not via user interface
You can edit the property and add/remove options.  You can also create your own custom property to replace it and show that instead (this is a good option if the property in question is not editable)
You can also have conditional options  to show what you want and hide what you want.

Thank you <@U01GW2U4WMA>
Unfortunately if I will remove this option then HubSpot will not allow me to set this option value to this property.
What I would like to is have option that could not be set in UI
Creating your own custom replacement would work for this.  The original property will still be there under-the-hood

<@U01GW2U4WMA>
How can I create this replacement?
If I create another property (with options Gold, Platinum) that would be different from the first one (with options Gold, Platinum, Diamond)

yes - but you could show the property you want to your users while hiding the other one and then when they update your custom property (which only contains your selected options) you can have a workflow copy that change to the real property - does this make sense?
There may be other ways to accomplish what you want - but I think this would work

<@U01GW2U4WMA>
In this case client won't see Diamond option.I would like customer to be able to see this, but when customer selects another one, it should be impossible to select Platinum again, only Gold and Platinum
You can create different views for different users.  Not sure about the best way to dynamically do exactly what you want.

<@U01GW2U4WMA>
Is it possible to do it without property replacement? Maybe using some plugin on jquery somehow?
or maybe by using workflows
Well, anything is possible.  You'll have to experiment and see what you can come up with.  You could create a developer test portal to do that in a safe environment if desired.

Okay <@U01GW2U4WMA>
How can I add jquery to contact page?

I don't think you can - here is a link to a recent discussion on what you are trying to do if that helps....   <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Managing-the-visibility-of-property-options/idi-p/708222>
you could try reaching out to some of these people to see if they found any good solutions
Thank you <@U01GW2U4WMA>
